QuestionText: Which software development model focuses on iterative development and frequent stakeholder feedback?
What does UML stand for in software engineering?
Which phase in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) involves analyzing the requirements of the project?
What does the term 'refactoring' refer to in software engineering?
OptionA: Optimizing code without changing its functionality
OptionD: Converting a software project to a new platform

QuestionText: The primary goal of software engineering is:
OptionA: To develop theoretical frameworks for computation
OptionB: To produce software with minimal cost and effort
OptionC: To produce reliable and maintainable software efficiently

QuestionText: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of the Waterfall model?
OptionD: Best suited for projects with well-defined requirements

QuestionText: Which design principle focuses on separating software into modules that are cohesive and minimize interdependencies?
In software testing, which type of test focuses on how the system behaves under stress conditions?
Which type of software maintenance involves fixing bugs discovered after the software is deployed?
What is the main advantage of using version control systems in software engineering?
OptionB: Ensures collaboration and tracks changes to code
